At that time, in the city of RÄjagá¹›ha, King BimbisÄra had a daughter who wanted to go out

You are all my daughter's attendants. Surround her in that place.
The food and drink of the king, you always eat and drink.
In that city of RÄjagá¹›ha, there were many women, a thousand in number. Having heard this, they adorned themselves with various ornaments.

Those women, seeing these rare and delightful flowers, were overjoyed and could not contain themselves. Wanting to pick those flowers, they could not pick them and could not stay away. Stretching out their hands to pick them, they could not reach the flowers, which were a foot away. Seeing those flowers all moving towards Mount Vaá¹‡ka and not staying,
At that time, the crowd of people, the thousand women, and the daughter of King BimbisÄra gradually left RÄjagá¹›ha.
Those flowers moved slowly in front of the crowd, and the crowd did not know whether they were moving or not. The people thought:
These flowers are close to our hands but we cannot pick them up.
Then all those flowers went up to Mount Vaipulya, and those men and women also went up the mountain.
After going up the mountain, they saw the TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha, surrounded by countless hundreds of thousands of people, expounding the Dharma for them.
At that time, the twenty-eight sisters joined their palms in front of the Buddha and requested the World-Honored One.
Then the daughter of King BimbisÄra, having seen all those women, also saw those sisters requesting the World-Honored One.
She said this:
Why are these women standing before the World-Honored One with palms joined?ğŸ”½What do they seek?
What wish do they desire?
Then they heard a voice from the sky saying:
They wish to see the body of Bodhisattva No-Existence, except for the Buddha's body, which is invincible in the three realms.
They all spoke with one voice, saying:
We wish to see the body of that Bodhisattva.
Having said this, the flowers and so forth in the hands of the people were scattered over the TathÄgata, and they said:
We only wish, World-Honored One,
to see the body of Bodhisattva No-Existence.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to Bodhisattva No-Existence:
Good man!

You should manifest your perfect body, allowing many beings to see your body and plant the causes of enlightenment. You will also be like them, planting good roots in the presence of many hundreds of thousands of Tathagatas.
At that time, Bodhisattva No-Existence immediately manifested his body.

At that time, the great earth trembled everywhere, becoming peaceful and moist. No beings were frightened or had their hair stand on end. All musical instruments sounded without being played. In the sky, heavenly flowers rained down, and heavenly and human fragrances naturally burned everywhere.
At that time, Bodhisattva No-Existence manifested this perfect physical form.
When he manifested his body, the assembly of women all gave rise to love and affection. Each woman thought:
This Bodhisattva No-Existence
only interacts with me in a pleasurable way.
Each manifested in front of them, and they also did not know that it was the transformation of the spiritual powers. Each fulfilled their wishes under the trees in the forest on Mount Vipula.
We joyfully accept the bliss in this place. We have never heard such wonderful sounds, colors, fragrances, and so forth. We now are grateful for the World-Honored One's grace.

Those women each sat under a tree, in a palanquin of the seven treasures, with all the fruits of retribution fully complete, joyfully accepting the bliss. All their needs were fully provided, and they no longer thought of returning. In this way, they received the bliss of joy for seven days and seven nights.
At that time, the World-Honored One further spoke the essential Dharma for the sake of all beings:

If there are those who do not see the body of that bodhisattva, it is all due to their roots of goodness not yet being mature. Although they wish to see it, they will never be able to. They do not know what it is.

Those who see it will, after seven days, see the bodhisattva's body gradually decaying, losing its radiance, and the rewards of enjoyment all disappearing, leaving only a tree. Those bodhisattvas will gradually disappear and have no place to stay.
Then they will hear a voice in the sky saying:
All good men!

This is the true nature of all conditioned things. You should not give rise to the notion of permanence. You should abandon the notion of a woman's body and aspire to a man's body, an unequaled body, and the body of the buddhas.
You should give rise to the mind of supreme, perfect enlightenment and receive a man's body.
When those women heard this voice, in an instant their minds rested in tranquility, and they saw the TathÄgata's image endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man.
Having seen this, they all said:
May I attain such a wondrous body, unstained and unattached, like the Buddha's body, tranquil and free from afflictions.

When those women spoke these words, all of them transformed their female bodies and attained male bodies, except for those who had made vows in the past to make offerings to this Bodhisattva No-Existence and so forth, up to the site of enlightenment, after which they would transform their female bodies, and for this reason did not transform their female bodies.
Those who transformed their bodies and attained male bodies were upright and delightful, loved and respected by the heavenly beings and humans of the world.
At that time, the Buddha's image suddenly disappeared, and only the World-Honored One Shakyamuni was seen.
At that time, those women who had attained male bodies said to the Buddha,
How rare, World-Honored One!ğŸ”½How wonderful!
How special!
There has never been such an illusionist's performance before.
The minds of ordinary beings are confused and never stable, like a wheel pressing oil, and they are unable to abide near good and wise advisors.
World-Honored One!

If one is able to be close to good and wise advisors, make offerings and serve them, by the spiritual power of the good and wise advisors, I have now turned away from a female body and attained the five supernatural powers.
World-Honored One!

I now recall that in the past, for many thousands of Buddhas, I planted good roots together with good and wise advisors, giving up my own body and life, in order to enable us to give rise to various good roots, and also to show us those Buddha-World-Honored Ones, speaking of the matters of the various faults and harms of living at home, skillfully praising the merits and virtues of leaving the household life.

We have already been close to good and wise advisors for such a long time, and since then we have never again been born in the evil destinies. Because I have not yet encountered a teacher to teach me in the past, I have always been revolving in the realms of humans and gods, running around and experiencing various sufferings.
World-Honored One!
I can now take the worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, fill them with the seven treasures, or even fill them with my own body, and give them to a good and wise advisor.
Even if I do this, I still cannot repay the kindness of a good and wise advisor.
Why is this?

It is because of this spiritual power that we will be able to become Buddhas in the world, reveal and accomplish our Buddha lands. It is all because of these good and wise advisors that they teach us to go to the Buddhas and plant various wholesome roots, teach us to practice various expedient means quickly and skillfully, and teach us to enter the profound Dharma practices.

Sometimes they speak loving words, sometimes they show scolding, sometimes they speak of coolness, sometimes they speak of heat, sometimes they are oppressive. They teach in this way, having given up all pleasures and all benefits. Those beings are difficult to encounter, and those beings have not yet been able to discern.
If one does not obtain this good and virtuous friend, except for the TathÄgata, we have no other good and virtuous friend like the bodhisattva mahÄsattva Ajita.
At that time, the bodhisattva mahÄsattva Ajita said to the women who had transformed their male bodies:
Good men!
I now not only act as a good and virtuous friend for you alone, I also act as a good and virtuous friend for all sentient beings.
Good men!

If there are sentient beings who are able to know the bodhisattva Ajita, who acts to benefit and accomplish sentient beings, those sentient beings will no longer serve other teachers and friends, those sentient beings will forget about food and drink, will not give rise to doubts or retrogression, and will have no desires, and will day and night draw near to me.
Why is this?

I now teach all sentient beings to harmonize their wholesome roots, enabling them to abide in all worldly and supramundane perfections, to enter immeasurable perfections, to enter all merits, to abide in the place of pure, unobstructed, and non-inverted [mind], not manifesting any characteristics of existence, abiding in the place of non-action, and delighting in cultivating the perfection of physical and mental cultivation.

I have already enabled immeasurable sentient beings to abide in such skillful wisdom. My true words now have no different meaning. The Buddha himself knows and certifies it, and the devas and humans in the world bear witness to it.
The Buddha said:
Good man!
It is just as you have said.
At that time, by the Buddha's spiritual power, the great assembly immediately saw a thousand buddhas in the east, south, west, and north.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to the great assembly:
Good men!
Have you now seen these buddhas?
They said:
World-Honored One!
We have all seen them.
The Buddha further said:
They have already caused this good man to mature in this way for anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi.
They again rejoiced and said:
World-Honored One!
We have now in this world transformed our female bodies and attained male bodies.
World-Honored One!
Therefore, we now deeply believe in this matter, understand this matter, and keep this matter in mind without doubt.
World-Honored One!
We have now attained entry into the Buddha's great spiritual powers, gradually in small part, all due to the spiritual powers of this bodhisattva AsvabhÄva.

We wish to attain the spiritual powers of the buddhas and fully manifest them. We wish to plant various roots of goodness together with him in the presence of the buddhas and attain the fulfillment of all merits.
At that time, those Bodhisattva-MahÄsattvas thought like this in their minds:
The body is a combination of the five aggregates and cannot be obtained. It is only by the spoken words that it can be heard.
How can we plant wholesome roots together with him?
At that time, the World-Honored One, knowing the thoughts in the minds of those Bodhisattvas, said to the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva AsvabhÄva:
Good man!

You should now explain to these Bodhisattva-MahÄsattvas the matter of the body that is a combination of the five aggregates. You should now reveal to these Bodhisattvas the body that is a combination of the five aggregates. Having heard this, they will destroy the view of self and will further approach the Buddha's enlightenment.
At that time, in the assembly there was a Bodhisattva named Loving Speech, who said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
What have you seen now that the TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One does not explain himself, but rather encourages that Bodhisattva No-Thing to explain?
The Buddha said:
Good man!
This assembly has long followed and flowed towards No-Thing, therefore I now encourage this Bodhisattva MahÄsattva to speak.
At that time, Bodhisattva No-Thing said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
I now wish to speak, as I see it, just as the Buddha's form is empty, so is my form;
just as the Buddha's form, so are the forms of all sentient beings;
just as the forms of sentient beings, so are the forms of all trees, forests, and medicinal herbs;
just as the forms of all trees, forests, medicinal herbs, and so forth, so are the forms of all the aggregates of elements and compounded things.

All empty forms, my forms, the TathÄgata's forms, the forms of all sentient beings, the forms of all trees, forests, and medicinal herbs, and the forms of all realms and aggregates of dharmas, are without dualistic characteristics.

They are without knowledge, without movement, without birth, without equality, without anything equal to them, without activity, without speech, neither dharmas nor non-dharmas, not subsumed within the dharma realm or the non-dharma realm, neither empty nor non-empty.

Sentient beings are foolish, ignorant, and unaware. They falsely grasp, are stingy, and jealous. They are unable to extract the false poisonous arrow. Within stinginess and jealousy, they forget kindness and righteousness. Covered by the net of ignorance, they distance themselves from good and wise advisors and have much doubt.
They are unable to listen to and accept such dharmas, and will create obstacles. They are unable to uphold, recite, cultivate, and realize them through contact.
There are bodhisattvas whose wisdom is skillful, like space, and who are unattached. Among all worldly dharmas, they do not grasp the notion of dharmas, let alone any other notions?
They are able to enter this Dharma practice.

Those of little wisdom may have this thought in the formless realm, hoping to enter this Dharma practice. In the formless realm, they mistakenly give rise to the thought of practice. In brief, up to feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness, they act in the same way as with form. Like the space of consciousness, my consciousness is also like that;
like that consciousness, the TathÄgata's consciousness is also like that;
like the TathÄgata's consciousness, the consciousness of all sentient beings is also like that;
like the consciousness of all sentient beings, the consciousness of all trees, forests, herbs, and grasses is also like that;
like the consciousness of all trees, forests, herbs, and grasses, the consciousness of the combination of all elements is also like that.

The space of consciousness, my consciousness, the TathÄgata's consciousness, the consciousness of all sentient beings, the consciousness of all trees, forests, herbs, and grasses, and the consciousness of the combination of all elements are non-dual.

It is unknowable, cannot be discriminated, unborn, unequaled, without activity, cannot be given a name, is neither dharma nor non-dharma, is not included in the dharma realm or non-dharma realm, is neither empty space nor non-empty space.

Sentient beings are foolish, unaware, ignorant, have little wisdom, little learning, are jealous and stingy, or attached, bound by jealousy and hatred, covered by the net of ignorance, and those who are grasped by bad friends are each deluded. They want to hear this Dharma, but create obstacles, are unable to uphold, recite, practice, and realize its meaning.
There are bodhisattvas who skillfully understand without attachment. They do not obtain the concept of dharmas among all dharmas, let alone other concepts.
They are able to practice within this practice.
Those with little wisdom and so forth are unable to know this Dharma practice.
When he spoke of these five kinds of equality, liberation, and the imperishability and non-differentiation of all conditioned phenomena, the earth shook and flowers rained from the sky.
At that time, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva Difficult to Tame addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
What causes and conditions led to the great earthquake and the rain of flowers in the sky?
The Buddha told the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva Difficult to Tame:
Good man!

This is because he spoke of the five aggregates as empty, non-dual, non-differentiated, without anything to rely on, inexpressible, without accumulation, without disintegration, without boundaries, and not delighting in delusion.
When he spoke of this abode of mastery of all buddhas, hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of nayutas of devas all attained the forbearance of the non-arising of dharmas.

In this assembly, five thousand bhiká¹£us, bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä«s, upÄsakas, and upÄsikÄs all attained the forbearance of the non-arising of dharmas. In the future they will become buddhas, called the TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One born from the accumulation of inexpressible merits. They will appear in the world in the eon named Without Abiding. For this reason, the great earth trembled and rained down various flowers.
At that time, the women who had attained male bodies all spoke in unison, saying in verse:
False and not false, false and false love,
Truly knowing these, therefore all are prophesied.
We know this way, all are false,
Now attaining the body of a man, we are all complete.
Having heard the false, we know and understand, not giving rise to doubt,
Thus returning to falsity, truly there is no knowing or speaking.
In the unreal and unreal, they deceive and delude sentient beings.
Because they do not know the unreal, the teaching of non-existence is expounded.
There is nothing to be diminished, nor is there anything to be added.
There is no manifestation in the middle, but only a provisional name is spoken.
Equally without danger, it is said to be without dispersion.
Since there is no equal, let alone a superior one.
Its color resembles the shape of color, and its color is colored,
If one knows that color is illusory, there is nothing that can be real.
Feeling resembles the shape of contact, and because of feeling, it becomes feeling.
Having known that feeling is illusory, there is nothing that can be real about it.
Conceptualization is for the sake of desirous conceptualization, and consciousness manifests through conceptualization.
Having known that conceptualization is illusory, there is no place of true reality in it.
All activities are without mastery, and activities are provisionally manifested.
Knowing that all conditioned things are false, they are without true reality.
Consciousness has the meaning of cognition, therefore it manifests consciousness.
If one knows that consciousness is false, it is always like empty space.
Thus all are false, with worldly worries and sorrows,
Those foolish ones do not know, because they abide in the view of self.
They have no peace, they have nothing to dismiss,
They have no abode, the foolish ones do not know.
This Dharma is not easy to know, the meaning of quiescent extinction is difficult to understand,
Abiding in the thought of laziness, covered by evil deeds,
Not seeing the absence of anything, not hearing what they say,
There is no place to speak, and nothing to put in the middle.

At that time, after the former women who had transformed into men spoke these verses, in order to make offerings to the Buddha, they prostrated with their five limbs on the ground and bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet.
And spoke this verse:
Homage to the one with the greatest power, unsurpassed in all worlds,
The World-Honored One has great kindness, equal to the unattached.
Having spoken this verse, he bowed to the World-Honored One and stood with palms joined.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to the elder Ananda:
You should uphold this Dharma that Asvabhava has asked about, and now I will explain it extensively for people to illuminate this Dharma.
Ananda!

For what kind of beings should this Dharma be heard? Those who hear it will be able to extensively understand the meaning and the adornments of the words and phrases, and they will all certainly attain supreme, perfect enlightenment.

Even if they hear it but do not understand the meaning, in the future they will gradually be able to understand the meaning and practice it, and will touch and realize it, having planted various roots of goodness in the presence of many hundreds of thousands of nayutas of Tathagatas.
Why is it so?
The bodhisattva who has nothing has such a vow.
At that time, among the assembly there were women who abided in the Great Vehicle, who addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
Why do you exhort Ä€nanda to uphold this Dharma?
Why is that?
I have now received such a Dharma treatise, studied and recited it, and have become proficient in it.
World-Honored One!
Having heard this Dharma treatise now, in future lives I will explain it to others, and for asaá¹ƒkhyeya hundreds of thousands of nayutas of kalpas I will illuminate this Dharma.

At that time, among the assembly there were a hundred bhiká¹£us, six hundred bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä«s, two hundred upÄsakas and upÄsikÄs, and further there were nayutas of celestial sons who scattered various flowers over the World-Honored One, and said:
World-Honored One!
This sÅ«tra is able to illuminate all dharmas and reveal them as they truly are.
World-Honored One!
Having now heard this Dharma discourse, I am able to receive and uphold it, recite it and understand it, just as a clear mirror reflects one's face.
It is just like this, we have received and upheld this Dharma discourse.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
In the present and future worlds, we will widely explain this Dharma discourse for innumerable eons, glorifying this practice.
We will enable sentient beings to realize and awaken to it, and let them know that we benefit in this way.
We abide in bodhi, how should we act?
For the sake of all sentient beings and to perfect the Buddha Dharma.
World-Honored One!

We do not crave for offerings, fame, and so forth, but accept this Dharma to explain it for sentient beings. We also do not do it for our own lives, but only for all sentient beings, wishing to provide sentient beings with all kinds of happiness, wishing to cause them to approach the Buddha's teachings, and to eliminate the afflictions of attachment for immeasurable sentient beings.
The Buddha said:
Excellent!ğŸ”½Excellent!
Good men!
You have all spoken this Dharma well.
At that time, the sisters of the ocean said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
This Bodhisattva of No-Existence does not arise or speak like this.
Good men and good women!
Explaining this Dharma-basis is to illuminate it.
World-Honored One!

They will uphold the true Dharma, and also for all Buddhas of the past, future, and present, they will practice the Dharma. They will also uphold, recite, and master it, and teach others to recite and master it, and teach them to understand it.
At that time, the Bodhisattva MahÄsattva No-Existence said to the sisters of the ocean:
After innumerable hundreds of thousands of kalpas, at that time there was a kalpa called Dharma Jewel Blossoming, during which five hundred Buddhas appeared in the world.

At that time, there was a Buddha who first appeared in the world, named Duá¹£prasahaketu TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well-Gone, Knower of the Secular World, Unsurpassed Person, Tamer, Teacher of Gods and Men, Buddha, World-Honored One.

At that time, there were also many beings dwelling in the turbidity of afflictions, covered by karmic hindrances, with afflictions increasing, and the afflictions of greed, anger, and delusion increasing, filled with poison and afflictions.
Good women!

At that time, the Buddha DÄ«paá¹ƒkara TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, I asked such questions then, and that Buddha TathÄgata also explained them in the same way as the present World-Honored ÅšÄkyamuni TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One.
Good women!

In this way, the next five thousand buddhas were also asked about this Dharma treatise in the same way, and those World-Honored Ones also explained it for me in the same way as the present World-Honored ÅšÄkyamuni, the King among ÅšÄkyas, explained it for me.
Good sister!
You should now be at ease.
Good sister!
From now on, in the future, I will also ask these buddhas, whose number is beyond measure and calculation, about this Dharma treatise.
In all these buddha-lands, there will be sentient beings with afflictions and defilements, some few and some many.

At that time, when the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva No-Existence spoke these words, in an instant, King BimbisÄra, the lord of Magadha, surrounded by his four divisions of troops, gradually approached the place where the women had gone and came to where the Buddha was.
Having arrived where the Buddha was, he bowed his head at the Buddha's feet and then sat to one side.
After the Buddha had consoled him, he sat down on the seat that had been arranged, and the great assembly also sat down.
Then King BimbisÄra said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
I have a young daughter who went out to the garden with her maidservants, but after a long time she still has not returned. Later, we searched for her in the garden but could not find her.
We also heard that she went to where the World-Honored One was, but now I still cannot see her in this assembly.
The Buddha told the great king:
You will see her at this assembly.
The king said:
World-Honored One!
I still have not seen her.
The Buddha said:ğŸ”½Great king!
Great King!
You may now ask the Bodhisattva No-Existence, he will show you the place.
The king said:
World-Honored One!
Who is this Bodhisattva No-Existence?
Which one is he?
At that time, the World-Honored One told the Bodhisattva No-Existence:
You, No-Existence!
You should now answer King BimbisÄra's question about where the women have gone, so that this assembly may know.
At that time, the Bodhisattva No-Existence, without revealing his body, told King BimbisÄra and the great assembly:
Great King, you should know that those women are in this assembly.
The king said:
Great Being!
I only hear your voice but do not see your form.
The Bodhisattva said:
Great King!

Now, all the women who have heard my name, one by one, have gone under the tree, taken my body, and indulged as they wish. After taking my body, they have all abandoned their female bodies and received male bodies.
Since those women have taken my body and become men, I am then without a body.
However, the Bodhisattva Without Distraction said to those women who had become men,
You good men!
Each of you should manifest your own virtues.
At that time, the women who had obtained male bodies gathered in one place, with the complete characteristics of a man, upright and pleasing, and said like this:
We have now abandoned our female bodies and have become such men.
At that time, King BimbisÄra and the great assembly gave rise to doubt and disbelief.
At that time, the Bodhisattva Without Distraction said again,
Great King!
Why do you and the people still harbor doubts?
How can you not believe the Buddha now?
If you can believe it, the Tathagata is right here. You should ask him now:
'Is what this good man says different or not?'
At that time, King Bimbisara said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
It is just as you say.
Is it not as the voice in the sky said?
But I do not see his body.
At that time, the Buddha told King Bimbisara:
It is just as you say.
Great King!
It is all just as the Bodhisattva has said.
Great King!
You should now believe these words and not give rise to doubt.
When the king heard these words, he immediately rose, put his palms together, and said three times:
Excellent!
He said:
World-Honored One!
Whose spiritual power is this?
Is it the power of the Bodhisattva's non-existence?
Or is it the power of the Buddha's majestic spiritual power?
The Buddha told the king:
Great King!
You should know that this is the power of the vows of these women from the past.

In the past, they taught these women to plant various roots of goodness, generate the mind of enlightenment, and achieve accomplishment in the Buddha's teachings. Therefore, I have now fulfilled their wishes.
Great King!
There will also be women in the future who will further teach and transform countless women to attain the transformation of their female bodies.
At that time, the Buddha told the Bodhisattva of No-ownership:
Good man!
You can now cause these women to each return to their original bodies for the sake of the people in this assembly?
At that time, the Bodhisattva of No-ownership said these words:
As I truly say, I have caused countless women to transform their female bodies and attain the body of a man, all of which is true.
These beings will return to their female bodies!

When this was said, many women appeared in front of those men in such forms, such colors, and such postures as before, and they returned to their previous states as they had come, and they each spoke to each other as before, without any difference.
At that time, the women and King BimbisÄra and the others gave rise to a rare thought:
How is it that the women have already transformed their female bodies and now have returned to their previous female bodies?
Are these women real bodies or are they emanations?
The Buddha said:
Great King!
These women are neither real nor emanations.
Why is it so?
Great King!
This good man had such a vow in the past.

If any woman sees my body, upon seeing my body she will give rise to this aspiration and seek to transform her female body. For those women, their husbands will take other wives, but they will be just like before, neither increasing nor decreasing, with lovely and upright bodies, inseparable.
At that time, King BimbisÄra said to the Buddha:
It is rare, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have such spiritual powers and wholesome roots.
World-Honored One!
All dharmas are inconceivable, the karmic retributions of sentient beings are inconceivable, and the realm of concentration of those who attain concentration is inconceivable.
The Buddha said:
So it is, so it is.
Great King!
So it is, so it is.
Great King!
There are three kinds of inconceivability.
What are the three?
The measure of the illusions of karma and illusions is missing one sentence in the Sanskrit text.
This good man has already awakened to all illusions, has already realized them, and has already touched them.
This good man is the illusionist, therefore these cannot be measured.

At that time, the World-Honored One caused that great assembly to be taught and spoken to with the Dharma of non-existence, to attain joy, to attain spiritual power and increase in teaching, and after causing them to rejoice, he exhorted them, saying:ğŸ”½You!
Each of you should know the time to return to where you came from.
At that time, the multitudes each returned to their original places.
Not long after they left, there was a bodhisattva named Doubt-Arising who said to the Buddha,
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva Non-Existence was able to transform these beings with his spiritual powers and cause them to return to their original state, without causing those beings to have the suffering of separation.
World-Honored One!
What kind of benefits will they create?
The Buddha told the bodhisattva Doubt-Arising,
Good man!

Wherever these people are, together with these women who have changed their faculties, they speak, eat and drink, enjoy themselves, play and amuse themselves, various things, various methods, at that time and place, causing these people to give rise to the mind of enlightenment in regard to bodhi, and to approach the Buddha's teachings.
Why is this?
